teamMembers.name: Adam Deller
teamMembers.quote: Precise pulsar astrometry allows us to map our Galaxy's structure and test fundamental theories of gravity.

teamMembers.name: Walter Brisken
teamMembers.quote: VLBI techniques enable us to measure pulsar distances with unprecedented accuracy.

teamMembers.name: Miller Goss
teamMembers.quote: The mapping of millisecond pulsars provides crucial insights into galactic structure and evolution.

teamMembers.name: Shami Chatterjee
teamMembers.quote: Pulsar astrometry is a key tool for understanding gravitational wave detection through pulsar timing arrays.

teamMembers.name: Jim Cordes
teamMembers.quote: Millisecond pulsars are nature's most precise clocks, allowing us to probe the fabric of spacetime itself.

teamMembers.name: Joe Lazio
teamMembers.quote: MSPSRPI helps us understand the galactic electron density distribution and improve interstellar medium models.

teamMembers.name: Yuri Kovalev
teamMembers.quote: International collaboration in VLBI techniques enables us to achieve the highest possible astrometric precision.

teamMembers.name: Leonid Petrov
teamMembers.quote: Precise reference frames are critical for measuring distances across the cosmos.

teamMembers.name: Gemma Janssen
teamMembers.quote: The MSPSRPI project provides essential astrometric measurements for pulsar timing array efforts.

teamMembers.name: Ben Stappers
teamMembers.quote: Understanding pulsar distances is fundamental to interpreting their timing behavior and properties.
